itemDescription: Bishop of London; Bishop of Chester; Bishop of Willesden; British Anglican bishop (1910-1992)

wikipedia_page.main: Gerald Alexander Ellison  (19 August 1910 – 18 October 1992) was an Anglican bishop and rower. He was the Bishop of Chester from 1955 to 1973 and the Bishop of London from 1973 to 1981.

response: In his biography, Trevor Huddleston: Turbulent Priest, Piers McGrandle quotes Archbishop Desmond Tutu and Bishop Gerald Ellison dismissing the claims as a plot by the South African Bureau of State Security (B.O.S.S.) to discredit a prominent opponent of apartheid.  Tutu wrote the foreword for the McGrandle book, and Archbishop Rowan Williams the afterword.  McGrandle was a part-time chaplain to Huddleston, and wanted to introduce Huddleston to a new generation.  At a service to mark the Centenary of Huddleston's birth in June 2013, many people testified to the impact Huddleston had made on their faith and practice as Anglicans, and others, as activists.
Bishop Gerald Ellison, the Bishop of London when Huddleston was Bishop of Stepney, also said that political enemies of Huddleston were involved.
